meanings.definition: The act of installing something again.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the company had to do multiple reinstallations of their damaged equipment.
meanings.sent2: I had to do several reinstallations of the app on my phone to fix the bugs.
meanings.sent3: The constant need for reinstallations was starting to feel like a never-ending cycle.
meanings.sent4: The reinstallations of the security system were like putting up a fortress around the building.
meanings.sent5: The reinstallations of the software were like hitting the reset button on my computer.

meanings.definition: The process of setting up software or equipment on a computer for a second time.
meanings.sent1: The IT department handled the reinstallations of the software after the system crash.
meanings.sent2: When the computer froze, I had to go through the whole process of reinstallations.
meanings.sent3: The reinstallations of the programs felt like a tech dance routine on my computer.
meanings.sent4: The reinstallations of the apps were like rearranging puzzle pieces on the screen.
meanings.sent5: The reinstallations of the drivers were like tuning up the engine of a car.
